column1: Comedic improv therapy, a group therapy model inspired by the practice of improv comedy, provides a novel treatment for severe social anxiety disorder by harnessing the following therapeutic elements: (a) group cohesiveness, (b) intense play, (c) profound exposure, and (d) humor.
